title.value: Гистологические изменения в вымени коров при субклиническом мастите
Histologic changes in cow udder at subclinical mastitis
Histologic changes in cow udder at subclinical mastitis

journal.title: Agriculture - Problems and Prospects : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Bashura, A.V., Grodno State Agrarian Univ. (Belarus)

abstract.value: Mastitis is a prevailing disease of milk cows in the countries where they are bred. It is mostly subclinical mastitis that threatens dairy cattle. It can affect from 9,4 to 13,7 percent of udder parenchyma without any apparent clinical signs, which can lead to huge expenditures and losses. In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented the results of the examination of bovine mammary gland histological structure in subclinical mastitis. As a result of carried out research it has been established, that subclinical mastitises of cows are clinically difficultly diagnosed, but can be certain by histology. At a subclinical mastitis defeats of all udder structurally functional elements are found out. On damage of alveoluses and intralobular ducts , in the gland basis, are 21,1-33,9%, in udder thickness - 25,6-40,4%, in the field of the milk cistern - 15,2-35,4% from all lobule volume. It corresponds to 21 33,5% of defeats of all secreted apparatus of lobules that 9,4-13,7% of all mammary gland parenchyma are equivalent.
